attributes.additional_details:
Before participating in attacks on Syria, the British government should clearly outline the outcomes and mitigating strategies, once the Assad regime is destabilised. 

Destabilising the regime will allow for militant unsecular groups to rise. 

Syria 'chemical attack': What we know http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-39500947 

‘Syria will implode if Assad goes', says Peter Ford http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-39562082
attributes.background:
Calling all MPs and UK government to STOP BOMBING SYRIA. We do not want to repeat Iraq! 
To gather genuine British evidence to determine responsibility for the chemical attacks.
The UK government should have regular direct talks with the Syrian government and report back with the outcomes. 

✌️
